Others: Germany were held to a 0-0 draw by Ukraine in a friendly match as part of their Euro 2024 preparations.
Julian Nagelsmann, Germany's head coach, expressed satisfaction with his team's performance, stating they played well for long stretches but lacked a cutting edge.
Pascal Gross, Brighton midfielder, deputized for Toni Kroos and performed admirably, pulling the strings alongside Robert Andrich.
Ilkay Guendogan had Germany's best first-half chance but mistimed his jump on a teasing cross by Gross.
Maximilian Beier, who came off the bench in the second half, rattled the inside of the post with a first-time shot from Andrich's through ball.
Thomas Mueller praised the impact of Maximilian Beier, stating he deserved a goal and the team needed a bit of luck.
Ukraine's back line held firm against Germany's attacks, leading a string of top saves by goalkeeper Anatolii Trubin.
Ukraine will be buoyed by denying the tournament hosts on home soil as they look to come through a group that also includes Romania, Slovakia, and Belgium.
